abstract: Nepalese police kill four ethnic Madhesis during large protest against how provincial boundaries will be determined in country's proposed constitution; 34 people have been killed in recent demonstrations, while general strike has shut down services in most of the region for nearly month.
lead_paragraph: The police opened fire after ethnic Madhesi protesters tried to set fire to government buildings, an official in the Mahottari district said.

headline.main: 4 Killed by Nepal Police in Clashes Over Draft Constitution
headline.print_headline: Asia; Nepal: Police Gunfire Kills 4 Protesters

snippet: The police opened fire after ethnic Madhesi protesters tried to set fire to government buildings, an official in the Mahottari district said.
